articles.headline: Boy Scouts Will Accept Girls, in Bid to ‘Shape the Next Generation of Leaders’
articles.snippet: The shift was a significant change for the Boy Scouts, where membership has slipped in recent decades. Girl Scouts leaders said they were “blindsided” by the move.
articles.abstract: The shift was a significant change for the Boy Scouts, where membership has slipped in recent decades. Girl Scouts leaders said they were “blindsided” by the move.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Boy Scouts of America announced plans on Wednesday to broadly accept girls, marking a historic shift for the century-old organization and setting off a debate about where girls better learn how to be leaders.
articles.byline: By Julie Bosman and Niraj Chokshi

articles.headline: Trump’s Tough Talk on Nafta Raises Prospects of Pact’s Demise
articles.snippet: The president has long talked about scrapping Nafta. Even skeptics are starting to believe him.
articles.abstract: The president has long talked about scrapping Nafta. Even skeptics are starting to believe him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The North American Free Trade Agreement, long disparaged by President Trump as bad for the United States, was edging closer toward collapse as negotiators gathered for a fourth round of contentious talks here this week.

articles.headline: Passengers Suffer as Crowded Field Puts Pressure on Europe’s Airlines
articles.snippet: Weaker carriers have fallen by the wayside amid fierce competition, while others have been hit by bad luck. The result: thousands of canceled flights.
articles.abstract: Weaker carriers have fallen by the wayside amid fierce competition, while others have been hit by bad luck. The result: thousands of canceled flights.
articles.lead_paragraph: Adela Vyhnakova arrived at Dublin Airport this month hoping that nothing else would go wrong with her trip to the Spanish island of Gran Canaria.
articles.byline: By Amie Tsang and Zach Wichter

articles.headline: Foiled in Congress, Trump Moves on His Own to Undermine Obamacare
articles.snippet: President Trump is expected to issue an order on Thursday to allow the sale of health insurance plans that are exempt from some Affordable Care Act rules.
articles.abstract: President Trump is expected to issue an order on Thursday to allow the sale of health insurance plans that are exempt from some Affordable Care Act rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, after failing  to repeal the Affordable Care Act in Congress, will act on his own to relax health care standards on small businesses that band together to buy health insurance and may take steps to allow the sale of other health plans that skirt the health law’s requirements.
articles.byline: By Robert Pear and Reed Abelson

articles.headline: How Did NBC Miss Out on a Harvey Weinstein Exposé?
articles.snippet: Ronan Farrow was an NBC contributor when he began reporting on claims that Mr. Weinstein had mistreated women. The article ended up being published by The New Yorker.
articles.abstract: Ronan Farrow was an NBC contributor when he began reporting on claims that Mr. Weinstein had mistreated women. The article ended up being published by The New Yorker.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Ronan Farrow made a guest appearance on MSNBC’s “The Rachel Maddow Show” on Tuesday night, he tried to make it clear that he was the reporter, not the story.

articles.headline: Weinstein Company Was Aware of Payouts in 2015
articles.snippet: As the company seeks to distance itself from Harvey Weinstein, there are conflicting accounts about what it knew and how it responded.
articles.abstract: As the company seeks to distance itself from Harvey Weinstein, there are conflicting accounts about what it knew and how it responded.
articles.lead_paragraph: With Harvey Weinstein fired amid escalating allegations of sexual harassment and misconduct, the business he helped create is consumed not just with what he is accused of doing, but with what other company leaders knew and how they responded.

articles.headline: Facing Down the Network That Protected Harvey Weinstein
articles.snippet: It takes more than a determined reporter to win against the aggressive flacks and lawyers who work for powerful executives.
articles.abstract: It takes more than a determined reporter to win against the aggressive flacks and lawyers who work for powerful executives.
articles.lead_paragraph: Because of the stories that have come out over the last week concerning the complaints about the movie mogul Harvey Weinstein, including two deeply reported New York Times investigative stories and an 8,000-word report from The New Yorker, readers now know all about his alleged pattern of sexual misconduct that victimized numerous women stretching back decades. And many of them are asking on social media why the story didn’t come out sooner.

articles.headline: Trump Warns Storm-Ravaged Puerto Rico That Aid Won’t Last ‘Forever’
articles.snippet: Tweets that partly blamed Puerto Rico for the crisis set off alarms on the island and sent the president’s aides scrambling to reassure its residents.
articles.abstract: Tweets that partly blamed Puerto Rico for the crisis set off alarms on the island and sent the president’s aides scrambling to reassure its residents.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The message was as stark as it was startling. Three weeks after a killer hurricane ravaged Puerto Rico, President Trump indicated on Thursday that he was losing patience. At least some of the blame for the continuing crisis is yours, he told the island territory, and the federal government will not stay “forever.”
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Caitlin Dickerson

articles.headline: Unity Deal Offers Hope for Palestinians and a Respite for Gaza
articles.snippet: The agreement allows the Palestinian Authority to run Gaza, potentially ending a 10-year standoff, but leaves thorny issues unresolved.
articles.abstract: The agreement allows the Palestinian Authority to run Gaza, potentially ending a 10-year standoff, but leaves thorny issues unresolved.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — After a decade of hostility and recrimination, the two main Palestinian factions came together in Cairo on Thursday to sign a reconciliation deal that holds out the tantalizing prospect of a united Palestinian front.
articles.byline: By Declan Walsh and David M. Halbfinger

articles.headline: Sheryl Sandberg Blitzes Washington in P.R. Push for Facebook
articles.snippet: Ms. Sandberg visited Washington, acting as the tech giant’s chief ambassador while trying to contain a spiraling public relations crisis.
articles.abstract: Ms. Sandberg visited Washington, acting as the tech giant’s chief ambassador while trying to contain a spiraling public relations crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For months, Facebook has been trying to counter criticism about its influence on the 2016 presidential election. The company has hired three crisis communications firms and has bought digital and newspaper ads. Mark Zuckerberg, its chief executive, has posted live video to the social network to explain how much he cared about election integrity.

articles.headline: Trump to Scrap Critical Health Care Subsidies, Hitting Obamacare Again
articles.snippet: The White House said President Trump was scrapping health insurance subsidies, and he signed a separate order allowing the sale of cheaper polices with fewer benefits.
articles.abstract: The White House said President Trump was scrapping health insurance subsidies, and he signed a separate order allowing the sale of cheaper polices with fewer benefits.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump will scrap subsidies to health insurance companies that help pay out-of-pocket costs of low-income people, the White House said late Thursday. His plans were disclosed hours after the president ordered potentially sweeping changes in the nation’s insurance system, including sales of cheaper policies with fewer benefits and fewer protections for consumers.
articles.byline: By Robert Pear, Maggie Haberman and Reed Abelson
